从实用灯光开始 Start with practical lights

Unlike the daylight setup, I was not able to cover the four shots satisfactorily without any tweaks per shot. Most of the time in production it is not possible anyway because shots are generally quite different from each other.

与日光设置不同，我无法在不对每张照片进行任何调整的情况下令人满意地拍摄四张照片。大多数时候在制作过程中这是不可能的，因为每张照片通常都有很大差异。

The daylight master example from chapter 5 is really a best-case scenario. In production I generally end up with one Master lighting per camera axis.

第 5 章中的日光主照明示例确实是一个最佳方案。在制作中，我通常会为每个摄像机轴设置一个主照明。

I will first show you the Master Rig as it is, without any modification per shot. So you can clearly see how far can we “push” the Master and what needs to be done in Shot Lighting. The general idea is always the same :

我将首先向您展示 Master Rig 的原样，每个镜头均不做任何修改。 这样您就可以清楚地看到我们可以将Master “推”到什么程度，以及在 Shot Lighting 中需要做什么。总体思路始终相同：

  • To get all the “​ingredients​” needed in the Master rig (the lights with their temperatures, exposure and size set globally).
  • 获取主装置所需的所有“​成分​”（全局设置的温度、曝光和尺寸的灯光）。
  • The “​recipe​” would then be provided on a per-shot basis.
  • 然后将根据每次拍摄提供“配方”。

让我们保持简单 Let’s keep it simple

I ALWAYS start​**simple**​ : in this particular scene I have started by lighting the set with practical lights. There is no lamp physically present but I will just put some area lights where I think these lamps should be. We have seen in chapter 5 that it is the best option for practical lighting.

我总是从简单​开始： 在这个特定的场景中，我首先用实际灯光照亮场景。 没有实际存在的灯，但我只会在我认为这些灯应该在的地方放置一些区域灯。我们在第 5 章中看到，这是实际照明的最佳选择。

A great way to make them interesting is the use of IES in your area lights. It allows you to create a nice pattern on walls and other large surfaces, like the floor. Large surfaces without any variation are always an issue in CG as seen in chapter 2.

让它们变得有趣的一个好方法是在区域灯光中使用IES。它允许您在墙壁和其他大面积表面（如地板）上创建漂亮的图案。如第 2 章所示，​没有任何变化的大面积表面在 CG 中始终是一个问题。

I tried to shape the furniture as much as I could and give depth to the scene by alternating areas of light and shade. Please note that I didn’t use any light-linking since I was happy with the amount of light spilled on the characters :

我尝试尽可能多地塑造家具，并通过交替使用光影区域来增加场景的深度。请注意，我没有使用任何光链接， 因为我对角色身上洒下的光量很满意：

  • On a live-action movie, this would be the exact same thing. Practical lighting generally barely affects the characters as seen in chapter 4.
  • 在真人电影中，情况完全一样。 实际照明通常几乎不会影响角色，如第 4 章所示。
  • These IES lights bounce on the characters and fill them a bit which helps to integrate them into the set.
  • 这些 IES 灯光在角色身上反射并稍微填充，有助于将它们融入到场景中。
  • This low-level of light leaves much space for dramatic lighting later on. This won’t be an issue.
  • 这种低水平的灯光为以后的戏剧性照明留下了很大的空间。这不会成为问题。

​

​

​

​

I have inverted the order of the slides above on purpose. It made more sense to work on practical lights in the wider shot.

我故意颠倒了上面幻灯片的顺序。在更宽的镜头中处理实际灯光更有意义。

跟随戏剧灯光 Follow with dramatic lights

Once I was happy with my practical lighting, which is mainly affecting the set like in real life, I may pursue with some dramatic lighting on the characters. We have seen the Dramatic Light Roles in chapter 4.

一旦我对实际照明感到满意（它主要像在现实生活中一样影响布景），我可能会在角色身上使用一些戏剧性的照明。我们在第 4 章中看到了戏剧性的灯光角色。

主灯 Key lights

Key lights are the main shaping lights. I have used two area lights in this scene, one for each character. Lights affect everything (no light-linking) but focus more on the faces (using a light filter shaped as a cone).

主光是主要的塑形光。我在这个场景中使用了两个区域光，每个角色一个。灯光影响一切（没有光链接），但更多地集中在面部（使用锥形光过滤器）。

​

​

​

​

The use of SSS on their faces helped for the soft look.

脸上使用 SSS 有助于营造柔和的外观。

You can really tell that the key lights should be fixed on the wide shot. They don’t have the same visual impact as the other shots.

你确实可以看出主光应该固定在广角镜头上。它们不像其他镜头那样具有视觉冲击力。

环绕灯 Wrap lights

Wrap lights help to soften the transition between the key and the core. We generally use soft sources, like big area lights. This terminology comes from Dave Walvoord’s presentation (based on Roger Deakins’ vocabulary).

环绕灯有助于柔化主光和核心光之间的过渡。我们通常使用柔和光源，例如大面积灯。这个术语来自Dave Walvoord 的演讲（基于 Roger Deakins 的词汇）。

​

​

​

​

Fill lights are quite similar as they avoid any black areas and reduce contrast.

补光灯非常相似，因为它们可以避免任何黑色区域并降低对比度。

I could have opened more the cone shader to illuminate the table on the wide shot.

我可以打开更多的锥体着色器来照亮广角镜头中的桌子。

Having a bright object between two characters ties them.

两个角色之间有一个明亮的物体将他们联系在一起。

边缘光 Rim lights

Rim lights give shape by outlining and generally faces the camera. There is one for each character in this scene.

轮廓光通过勾勒轮廓来塑造形状，通常面向镜头。此场景中的每个角色都有一个轮廓光。

​

​

​

​

Notice the rim lights bouncing back on their faces. It is quite nice.

注意边缘光反射到他们的脸上。非常漂亮。

Rim lights are really camera dependent and you can really tell something is wrong on the two last shots.

轮廓光确实依赖于相机，你可以从最后两张照片中看出有些地方出了问题。

They are not doing what they are supposed to do !

他们没有做他们应该做的事！

顶灯 Top light

The top light comes from above the scene, to give more directionality from the ceiling. I just created one big disk light above the characters and that was pretty much it. We are very much used to light coming from above as it has been described in chapter 7.

顶光来自场景上方，以便从天花板发出更多方向性。我只是在角色上方创建了一个大圆盘灯，差不多就是这样。我们非常习惯从上方发出的光，正如第 7 章中描述的那样。

​

​

​

​

Top lights are generally soft and subtle.

顶灯一般柔和而微妙。

My analysis is pretty simple : check the lights one by one and make sure they look consistent on each shot.

我的分析非常简单：逐一检查灯光，确保它们在每次拍摄时看起来一致。

A truly powerful technique !

真正强大的技术！

体积光 Volumetric lights

The volumetric lights are the only lights with light-linking : they only affect the volumetric box. These fog effects just work great : it is a very easy and cheap way to improve a composition, to create some depth and even cover some issues !

体积光是唯一具有光链接的光源：它们仅影响体积盒。这些雾化效果非常好：这是一种非常简单且便宜的方法来改善构图，创造一些深度，甚至掩盖一些问题！

​

​

​

​

These volumetric lights are the only one with light-linking.

这些体积光是唯一具有光链接的光。

I have spent more or less a week on this Master lighting, testing many, many, many different options. I am pretty much satisfied with the result and I don’t think that I would be able to improve these renders without tweaking the lights per shot. Which is what we are going to do next !

我花了差不多一周的时间在这个主照明上，测试了许多不同的选项。我对结果非常满意，如果不调整每个镜头的灯光， 我认为我无法改善这些渲染。这就是我们接下来要做的！

Thanks to my references, I kind of had a clear idea of what I wanted per shot. The idea was to :

感谢我的参考资料，我对每次拍摄想要的效果有了清晰的认识。我的想法是：

  • Having a perfect read of the characters.

与日光设置不同，我真的不想让前景保持在光线下。所以我使用了与第 6 章中看到的电影《雨果》完全相同的技巧。

不要害怕打破连续性。拍摄灯光应该是提高摄影水平的好机会。

这次拍摄对我来说是个很大的挑战。要清晰地了解角色，同时又要保持场景的趣味性和强烈的冲击力，这尤其困难。

计划稍有改变 A slight change of plan

At this point, I had worked two weeks on these four shots and I was still not satisfied with the overall look of my pictures. The lack of textures and surfacing was clearly not helping. But I felt it was just missing something else. After many attempts of using more colors, I gave up and started to look at more references.

此时，我已经花了两周时间拍摄这四张照片，但我仍然对照片的整体效果不满意。缺乏纹理和表面效果显然没有帮助。 但我觉得它只是缺少了其他东西。在多次尝试使用更多颜色后，我放弃了，开始寻找更多参考资料。

The final short film of Wild Tales (Director : Damián Szifron, DP : Javier Julia) gave me the final push I needed to finally bring some colors into my renders. If you haven’t watched it, just do it ! It is insanely good !

《荒原故事》 （导演：达米安·斯兹弗隆，摄影指导：哈维尔·朱利亚）的最后一部短片给了我最后的推动力，让我终于在渲染图中添加了一些色彩。如果你还没看过，那就去看吧！它真的太棒了！

This look, commonly called ​*Orange and Teal​, works really well in this short film. I found it quite subtle and properly balanced. The movie Smoke & Mirrors (Director : ​*Alberto Rodríguez**​, DP: Alex Catalán) is also a great example.

这种通常被称为*“橙色和青色”的造型在这部短片中效果非常好。我发现它非常微妙且平衡得当。电影 《烟与镜》 （导演：​*Alberto Rodríguez​，摄影指导：Alex Catalán**）也是一个很好的例子。

After watching these movies, I decided to go for a classic complementary scheme. Not the most original solution but after fifteen years working in the industry, I guess I kinda got formatted.

看完这些电影后，我决定采用经典的互补方案。这不是最新颖的解决方案，但经过 15 年的行业工作，我想我已经有点成型了。

最终结果 Final result

After seeing these Orange and Teal schemes, I played in Nuke with the Light Path Expression (LPE) to tweak the colors. It is a great way to test things in real-time without any noise. BUT once I am happy with the result, I ALWAYS copy back the values to Guerilla.

看到这些橙色和青色方案后，我在 Nuke 中使用 Light Path Expression (LPE) 来调整颜色。这是一种实时测试事物的好方法，没有任何噪音。但是****一旦我对结果感到满意，我总是将值复制回 Guerilla。

For a complementary scheme, the rule in lighting is pretty straight-forward : everything from a direction is in one color and everything from the opposite direction is in another color, so that the lights do not cancel each other.

对于互补方案，照明规则非常简单：来自一个方向的所有东西都是一种颜色，而来自相反方向的所有东西都是另一种颜色，这样灯光就不会互相抵消。

As seen in Chapter 2.

如第 2 章所示。

I have also recently developed a true fascination for complementary colors in volumetrics. I just love this trick ! And it is actually used in many movies, as you may have read in Chapter 7.

最近，我还对体积测量中的互补色产生了浓厚的兴趣。我就是喜欢这个技巧！实际上，很多电影都用到了这个技巧，您可能在第 7 章中已经读到过。

混合颜色对我来说仍然是一个挑战。

我总是尽量对意外的惊喜保持开放态度。实际上，你必须在控制和优雅之间找到适当的平衡。

A good artist lets the medium and materials take over to some extent as well.

优秀的艺术家在某种程度上也会让媒介和材料占据主导地位。

Like any other elements in your scene, volumetrics can help you for composition and depth. We have seen in Chapter 7 the use of complementary colors for volumetrics and I wanted to experiment with that.

与场景中的其他元素一样，体积可以帮助您实现构图和深度。我们在第 7 章中看到了体积互补色的使用，我想尝试一下。

使用不对称可以让你获得更好的外观。

光线的渐变在图像中非常重要。我知道有些艺术总监在创作作品时会大量使用它们。

​

​

​

​

​

Beware of the tilt-shift effect if you use too much depth of field.

如果使用太大的景深，请注意移轴效果。

Do not hesitate to stylize the depth of field ! Ideally we would have a camera shader to generate more effects such as lens distortion, glow and lens-flare.

不要犹豫，将景深风格化！理想情况下，我们会有一个相机着色器来生成更多效果，例如镜头失真、发光和镜头眩光。

If I remember correctly, first time that anamorphic depth of field was used in a Full CG feature film was on Wall-E (Director : Andrew Stanton, DP : ​**Danielle Feinberg**​). There is a pretty cool special feature about it :

如果我没记错的话，第一次在全 CG 电影中使用变形景深是在​ 《机器人总动员》 ​（导演：安德鲁·斯坦顿，摄影指导：​**丹妮尔·范伯格**​）中。它有一个非常酷的特殊功能：

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nvSUbzbmfc4

Also available on Dailymotion.

也可在Dailymotion上找到。

渲染设置 Render settings

Even my book is not technically-oriented I will share with you my settings. Straight from Guerilla Render :

尽管我的书不是技术导向的，但我还是会和你分享我的设置。直接来自 Guerilla Render：

  • Resolution : 1920 x 1080
  • 分辨率 ：1920 x 1080
  • Samples : 2048
  • 样本：2048
  • Adaptive Threshold : 0.03
  • 自适应阈值：0.03
  • Adaptive Min samples : 32
  • 自适应最小样本：32
  • Max Bounces : 16
  • 最大弹跳次数：16
  • Render time : 3h40 on an ASUS laptop (i7-5500U)
  • 渲染时间：华硕笔记本电脑（i7-5500U）3 小时 40 分钟

灯光限制 Constrain of lights

A question that I have been asked several times : should I constrain my lights to the character ? I have seen both setups. So I would say : ​it depends​.

这个问题我被问过好几次了：我应该把灯光限制在角色身上吗？ 我见过这两种设置。所以我会说：​这得看情况​。

Back in the day because of shadow maps we would constrain our lights to optimize their resolution. This is no longer necessary. The only reason to constrain a light would be if you want to maintain a certain lighting effect on a character as he is moving.

过去，由于阴影贴图的存在，我们会限制灯光以优化其分辨率。现在不再需要这样做了。限制灯光的唯一原因是，如果你想在角色移动时保持一定的照明效果。

限制在星 Constrain in The Star

Here is an example from The Star (Director : ​Timothy Reckart​, Art DIrector : ​Sean Eckols​). We were asked to maintain the bounce light on Mary (in the first shot) and Bo and Ruth (in the second shot).

这是《The Star》 （导演：Timothy Reckart，艺术总监：Sean Eckols ）的一个例子。我们被要求保持 Mary（第一个镜头）和 Bo 和 Ruth（第二个镜头）上的反射光。

We decided to constrain the bounce light (a disk area) to the character. Three main issues were :

我们决定将反射光（圆盘区域）限制在角色上。主要有三个问题：

  • Every time we received an alembic update, the constrain broke.
  • 每次我们收到 Alembic 更新时，约束就会被打破。
  • We had to be extra careful with lights penetrating the ground.
  • 我们必须格外小心，以免灯光穿透地面。
  • Choose carefully to which body part or locator you want to constrain.
  • 谨慎选择您想要约束的身体部位或定位器。

Ninjago中没有限制 No constrain in Ninjago

In the next example (I worked on the last eight shots) we chose a different solution.

在下一个例子中（我研究了最后八个镜头），我们选择了不同的解决方案。

We have seen in Chapter 4 that this sequence uses mainly natural lights. But I also added some area lights in strategic places to enhance the bouncing. They were not constrained to anything, so depending on the character position, they would have more or less effect.

我们在第 4 章中看到 ，这个序列主要使用自然光。但我还在战略位置添加了一些区域光来增强反射效果。它们不受任何限制，因此根据角色位置的不同，它们的效果会或多或少不同。

There is a great advantage to this : spatiality. We have seen many examples in this book where I encouraged you to put practical lights in their physical location. It will ground your scene into some plausible environment. So we could almost come with this rule :

这样做有一个很大的优势：空间性。 我们在本书中看到了很多 例子 ，我鼓励你将实际的灯光放在它们的物理位置。它会将你的场景置于一些合理的环境中。所以我们几乎可以得出这个规则：

Practical lights should not be constrained since they belong to the environment but dramatic lights can be in order to maintain a certain effect (like a fill or a​*shatner light*​ ) on a character.

实用灯光不应受到限制，因为它们属于环境，但戏剧灯光可以受到限制，以便对角色保持一定的效果（如补光灯或​*沙特纳灯）。*

I hope that makes sense.

我希望这是有道理的。

概括 Summary

In this chapter we have seen that :

在本章中，我们看到：

  • Shot lighting should be an opportunity to improve the look.
  • 拍摄灯光应该是一个改善外观的机会。
  • We should not be shy because of continuity.
  • 我们不应该因为连续性而害羞。
  • Tweaking lights between shots is not an issue if done properly.
  • 如果操作正确的话，在拍摄之间调整灯光不是问题。
  • Balancing the lights one-by-one and altogether is a great process.
  • 逐一平衡灯光是一个伟大的过程。
  • We must stay open to changes during the process.
  • 我们必须对这一过程中的变化保持开放态度。

结论 Conclusion

In this chapter I have tried to describe the process of ​Shot Lighting​. It is super important to come with a strong Master Lighting to anticipate any issues we may encounter on a sequence level. But it does not remove the need to polish and improve the lighting on a shot basis. If money and time allow it.

在本章中，我尝试描述了镜头照明的过程。拥有强大的主照明非常重要，可以预测我们在序列级别上可能遇到的任何问题。但这并不能消除对镜头进行打磨和改进照明的需要。如果金钱和时间允许的话。

链接 Links

Here are a few links if you want to dig a bit more on the subject :

如果你想更深入地了解这个主题，这里有一些链接：

  • Basic Lighting Techniques (Different types of lights)
  • 基本照明技术（不同类型的灯光）

entry.title: CG Cinematography 第 7 章：照明技术
entry.content:
• Chapter 7: Lighting Techniques - Chris Brejon - Chris Brejon
  • https://chrisbrejon.com/cg-cinematography/chapter-7-lighting-techniques/
  • CG Cinematography Lighting Techniques focus specifically on lighting tricks for Computer-generated imagery. My very personal recipe on some hot topics.

CG问题 The CG issue

We are going to review some techniques related to our medium. 3d softwares give us a tremendous amount of freedom but bring as well some constraints. How should we deal with those in an efficient way ? Should we put some limits ? It is not because you can create as many lights as you want that you should. With great power comes great responsibility.

我们将回顾一些与我们的媒介相关的技术。3D 软件给了我们极大的自由，但也带来了一些限制。我们应该如何有效地处理这些问题？我们应该设置一些限制吗？并不是因为你可以创建任意数量的灯光，你就应该这样做。 能力越大，责任越大。

什么是作弊？ What is cheating ?

It is actually a pretty hard question to answer to. Because cheating does not have the same definition at Illumination, Animal Logic or Ilion. It really depends on the studio and your supervisor : it is cultural.

这其实是一个很难回答的问题。因为作弊在 Illumination 、Animal Logic或 Ilion的定义并不相同。 这实际上取决于工作室和你的主管：这是一种文化。

If I look into a dictionary, cheating means acting dishonestly to gain an advantage.

如果我查一下字典，作弊的意思是采取不诚实的行为来获取优势。

But what does cheating mean in CG ? Does it mean I acted dishonestly ? In relation to what ? Reality ? Is using a blocker a cheat ? Is light-linking a cheat ? Or should we give artists the most adapted tools to their medium ?

但是，在 CG 中，作弊意味着什么？它是否意味着我行为不诚实？与什么有关？现实？使用阻断剂是作弊吗？光链接是作弊吗？或者我们应该为艺术家提供最适合其媒介的工具？

I do not like this word because it makes me feel guilty for doing my job. No I did not cheat, I did what I had to do to make it look good.

我不喜欢这个词，因为它让我对自己的工作感到愧疚。不，我没有作弊，我只是做了我必须做的事情，让事情看起来不错。

作弊示例 Cheating examples

着迷 Spellbound

Let’s look at this example from Spellbound (Director : ​Alfred Hitchcock​, DP : George Barnes). Let’s see if you can spot the trick.

让我们看看 《爱德华大夫》 (导演：阿尔弗雷德·希区柯克，摄影指导：乔治·巴恩斯)中的这个例子。看看你是否能发现其中的窍门。

“​Hitchcock […] couldn’t get clean focus on the gun and on Ingrid Bergman in the same frame. So he used a giant gun and a huge fake hand to get the effect that he wanted. ​”

“希区柯克无法在同一画面中清晰对焦枪和英格丽·褒曼。所以他用一把巨大的枪和一只巨大的假手来达到他想要的效果。 ”

指环王 Lord of the rings

Peter Jackson used “​forced perspective​” a lot on Lord of the rings (DP : Andrew Lesnie). In the pass of Caradhras, he used a ring of 18-inch circumference when Frodo has fallen and the ring is lying in the snow.

彼得·杰克逊在​ 《指环王》 （摄影指导：安德鲁·莱斯尼）中大量运用了“强制透视” ，在卡拉德拉斯隘口，当弗罗多坠落，戒指落在雪中时，他用了一个周长为18英寸的戒指。

​

​

​

The forced perspective trick is very well explained in the making-of.

强制透视技巧在制作过程中得到了很好的解释。

After seeing these examples, one would think that directors of photography cheat all the time on set. Really ? Did they act dishonestly to gain an advantage ? I don’t think so. I would rather use the word : enhancing. DPs manipulate and control their environment to enhance the reality.

看过这些例子后，人们会认为摄影指导在片场总是在作弊。 真的吗？他们是否通过不诚实的行为来获取优势？我不这么认为。我宁愿使用这个词：增强。 摄影指导操纵和控制他们的环境以增强现实。

It is NOT a cheat, it is a trick or a gag. On set DPs would generally use those words a lot. I know it may sound like a stupid detail but vocabulary in lighting is essential. And similar tricks are also used in lighting ! Even for a “basic” daylight exterior, DPs will use reflectors, black flags and many other tools on set. We should be able to control every element. It’s what DPs do.

这不是作弊，而是一种伎俩或噱头。在片场，摄影指导通常会经常使用这些词。我知道这听起来可能像是一个愚蠢的细节，但灯光词汇是必不可少的。 类似的技巧也用于灯光！即使是“基本的”日光外景，摄影指导也会在片场使用反光板、黑旗和许多其他工具。我们应该能够控制每个元素。这就是摄影指导的工作。

Issue in CG is that many supervisors do not want to give control to their team. They have seen so many horrors and crazy setups that they want to lock everything. I don’t blame them. But sups have to find the right balance between control and safety. A good way to empower a team rather than controlling it is training.

CG 的问题是，许多主管不想将控制权交给他们的团队。他们见过太多恐怖和疯狂的设置，所以他们想把一切都锁起来。我不怪他们。但主管必须在控制和安全之间找到适当的平衡。培训是赋予团队权力而不是控制团队的好方法。

A team should not feel controlled by the CG police every time they add a light.

团队不应该在每次添加灯光时都感到受到 CG 警察的控制。

一部著名的迪士尼电影 A famous Disney movie

One of the best stories I have ever heard. Get ready.

这是我听过的最精彩的故事之一。做好准备吧。

On a famous Disney movie, Rob Legato did a “trick” with a time lapse of a night sky. They went and shot a night sky out here in the Mojave desert. Rob also did a shoot with a light box and some paper with holes in it. Brought it into nuke and enhanced it, to something that was a bit more pleasing to the eye. Things like readability of the stars against a post dusk sky. He put them both in front of Jon Favreau in our review room and asked him to pick the one he liked best.

在一部著名的迪斯尼电影中，罗伯·莱加托 (Rob Legato) 对夜空的延时拍摄做了一个“花招”。他们去莫哈维沙漠拍摄了夜空。罗伯还用灯箱和一些有孔的纸拍摄了照片。把它带进核弹里并增强效果，让它看起来更赏心悦目。比如在黄昏后的天空中，星星的清晰度。他把这两张照片放在我们审阅室里的乔恩·费儒面前，让他选出他最喜欢的一张。

Here comes the best part !

最精彩的部分来了！

Without telling him what he had done and what was different. And Jon picked the one he shot with a light box and his explanation was : the stars feel real to me. It’s how I remember seeing stars coming out after dusk and getting brighter as the night goes on. It reminds me of my camping trips as a kid. Rob then tells him it’s fake and everyone bursts out laughing, even Jon ! It was pretty amazing to watch and Rob didn’t say much. He didn’t have to. But capturing how people remember things and what they hold on to is an art.

没有告诉他他做了什么，有什么不同。乔恩选了一张他用灯箱拍摄的照片，他的解释是：星星对我来说是真实的。我记得黄昏后星星会出来，随着夜幕降临，星星会越来越亮。这让我想起了小时候的露营旅行。 罗布告诉他这是假的，大家都笑了起来，甚至乔恩也是如此！看起来非常神奇，罗布也没多说什么。他没必要说。但捕捉人们如何记住事物以及他们坚持什么是一种艺术。

And this brilliant conclusion.

还有这个精彩的结论。

Our job is about perception more than reality. Reality can be boring. But people perceive things differently and that’s what DPS compare it to when they gauge how “real “something is.

我们的工作更多的是感知，而不是现实。 现实可能很无聊。但人们对事物的看法不同，这就是 DPS 在衡量某事物的“真实性”时所比较的。

Brilliant Ted talk from Rob Legato about this topic if you want to know more.

如果您想了解更多，请观看Rob Legato 关于这个话题的精彩Ted 演讲。

蜘蛛侠:平行宇宙 Spider-man : Into the Spider-Verse

Loved the movie like everyone else. There is probably a project of this quality and originality every ten years or so. I just wanted to share a couple of screenshots from the making-of.

和其他人一样喜欢这部电影。大概每十年左右就会出现一部如此高质量、如此独创的作品。我只想分享几张制作过程中的截图。

​

​

​

A strong art direction driving every department. Impressive !

强大的艺术指导推动着每个部门。令人印象深刻！

其他示例 Other examples

Andre Turpin​, DP of Playmobil : “We use tricks as much as we can. We put lights on the walls, the ceiling and even the floor sometimes.”

*Playmobil*的摄影指导​Andre Turpin​：“我们尽可能地使用技巧。我们有时会在墙壁、天花板甚至地板上放置灯光。”

Aymeric Montouchet, DP of Detroit: become human : ​ “The only thing we should not cheat in CG is the quadratic decay of light​.”

*底特律：成为人类*的摄影指导Aymeric Montouchet表示：​ “在 CG 中我们唯一不应该作弊的就是光的二次衰减​。”

好技巧和坏技巧 Good and bad tricks

Now we have seen that “​cheating​” is a terrible word, we have to wonder about the main differences between CG and live action. I totally agree that we should work like Digital Directors of Photography. But let’s not forget that each medium has its own properties, rules and limitations. I personally see two BIG differences between live-action and CG :

现在我们已经知道“​作弊​”这个词很可怕，我们不得不思考 CG 和真人秀之间的主要区别。我完全同意我们应该像数字摄影导演一样工作。但我们不要忘记，每种媒介都有自己的属性、规则和限制。 我个人认为真人秀和 CG 之间有两个很大的区别：

  1. Render engines’ limitations aka we are not doing spectral rendering.
  2. 渲染引擎的局限性，也就是说我们不进行光谱渲染。
  3. Sampling and render times aka this is not real time.
  4. 采样和渲染时间并不是实时的。

This is why I distinguish two types of tricks : good and bad. Render engines give us so many possibilities that it is very easy to do crazy stuff. We have to find a middle ground between the freedom we will give to the artists and the control we want to have on their methods.

这就是为什么我要区分两种技巧：好的和坏的。渲染引擎给了我们如此多的可能性，以至于我们很容易做出疯狂的事情。我们必须在给予艺术家的自由和我们希望对他们的方法进行控制之间找到一个中间地带。

Examples of good tricks :

好的技巧示例：

  1. Add lights so the shot relies less on indirect lighting ? YES.
  2. 添加灯光，使拍摄更少依赖间接照明？可以。
  3. Use a blocker to have some vignetting in a shot ? YES.
  4. 使用阻挡器可以让镜头中出现晕影吗？可以。
  5. Use light-linking to make your character pop ? YES.
  6. 使用光链接让你的角色流行起来？可以。

Examples of bad tricks. This is very personal by the way. You may disagree and I am happy to know what you think.

坏招数的例子。顺便说一句，这是非常个人的事情。 您可能不同意，我很高兴知道您的想法。

  1. Use light-linking to compensate for poor surfacing ? NO.
  2. 使用光连接来弥补不良的表面处理？不。
  3. Remove the walls from shadow casters to get more light into the room ? NO.
  4. 移除墙壁上的阴影投射器，让更多的光线进入房间？不。
  5. Start a Master Lighting with different lights for characters and sets ? NO.
  6. 开始使用不同灯光为角色和场景设置主照明吗？否。
  7. Change the decay of a light. NO. It has to be quadratic. Except Sun and Sky obviously.
  8. 改变光的衰减。不。 必须是二次的。显然，太阳和天空除外。
  9. Use some ambient lighting. NO. This is just wrong.
  10. 使用一些环境光。不。 这是错误的。
  11. Have non-physical albedo values. NO. Luminance has to be between 0.03<x<0.9.
  12. 具有非物理反照率值。不。 亮度必须介于 0.03<x<0.9 之间。

Ambient lighting has now (almost) disappeared thanks to PBR. The easiest way to describe it would be an EnvLight with no occlusion. I guess it is only used in video games.

由于 PBR，环境光现在（几乎）消失了。最简单的描述方式是没有遮挡的 EnvLight。我猜它只用于视频游戏。

作弊态度 Cheating attitude

In the introduction, I was explaining that this book is more focused on PBR productions. So if you base things off a “​ground truth​” or reality, yes, we can use the word “​cheat​“. The software is essentially building a model in which to emulate light in the real world with things like decay, bounce, global illumination…

在介绍中，我解释说这本书更侧重于 PBR 制作。因此，如果你以“基本事实”或现实为基础，是的，我们可以使用“欺骗​”这个词。该软件本质上是在构建一个模型，通过衰减、反射、全局照明等来模拟现实世界中的光线……

But this word is so negative. We should never make an artist feel guilty for having created a couple of extra lights. And if you want your artists to work in a certain way, because of art direction or render times, it is totally understandable. But train them so they know.

但这个词太消极了。我们不应该让艺术家因为多做了几盏灯而感到内疚。 如果你想让艺术家以某种方式工作，因为艺术指导或渲染时间，这是完全可以理解的。但要培训他们，让他们知道。

My lead at Animal used to tell me : “Whatever works”. Is it that simple ? If you only care about your shot, yeah that would do the trick. But lighting for me is about finding viable solutions that you can easily share with the team. Lighting is about building physical environments that stand correctly. If you start to remove walls, objects, link them together, exclude some others, what are you trying to achieve ? You are just destroying the plausibility of the CG world.

Animal 的领导曾经告诉我：“只要管用就行”。就这么简单吗？如果你只关心你的镜头，那当然可以。但对我来说，照明就是找到可行的解决方案，并轻松与团队分享。照明就是构建正确的物理环境。如果你开始移除墙壁、物体，将它们连接在一起，排除其他物体，你想达到什么目的？ 你只是在破坏 CG 世界的可信度。

光衰 Light decay

We have seen in a previous chapter that the Sun could either be a Spot or a Distant light. What visual difference does it make ? Actually a big one, because of the decay. The Lighting design for stylized animation paper explains pretty well light falloff.

我们在上一章中看到，太阳既可以是聚光灯，也可以是远光灯。这会带来什么视觉差异？实际上，差异很大，因为会衰减。风格化动画的照明设计论文很好地解释了光线衰减。

From Dave Walvoord : The natural falloff from light sources is another way to add depth to shots. The brightness of light diminishes in an inverse squared manner […]. Therefore, if you want a lot of falloff then a light should be placed close to the subject. This has the effect of increasing depth between objects. A light placed farther away has less falloff and will compress the space.

Dave Walvoord表示：光源的自然衰减是增加镜头深度的另一种方式。光的亮度以平方反比的方式减弱 […]。因此，如果您想要大量的衰减，那么应该将灯光放置在靠近拍摄对象的位置。这会增加物体之间的深度。放置得较远的灯光衰减较少，会压缩空间。

I personally prefer the term of decay. But it is very personal. Once again vocabulary is a very important part of our job.

我个人更喜欢“衰败”这个词。但这非常个人化。再次强调，词汇是我们工作中非常重要的一部分。

​

​

Great explanation and examples in this pdf.

这个 pdf 中有很棒的解释和示例。

The characters and camera are in the exact same place, and only the light is moved [in the renders above]. In the first image, the light is far away from the characters and the depth between them is compressed. In the second image the light is brought closer and there is a large amount of falloff from Hiccup in the front to Stormfly in the back. This produces the effect that the characters are farther away from each other. This technique can be used to great effect to change the depth of the shot.

角色和相机处于完全相同的位置，只有光线移动（在上面的渲染图中）。在第一幅图中，光线距离角色很远，它们之间的深度被压缩。在第二幅图中，光线被拉近，从前面的 Hiccup 到后面的 Stormfly 有大量的衰减。这产生了角色彼此距离较远的效果。这种技术可以很好地用于改变镜头的深度。

A supervisor once told me not to put any lights close to the character. I guess he is right if your goal is to tie the characters together. But it actually depends on what you want to achieve. Do you want to tie your characters together or do you want to separate them ? Both options are possible.

一位主管曾经告诉我不要在角色附近放置任何灯光。如果你的目标是将角色联系在一起，我想他是对的。但这实际上取决于你想要实现什么。你想将角色联系在一起还是想将它们分开？两种选择都是可能的。

Many artists have asked me these questions about decay : how do you manage if you want to have a very strong light on an element but it does not illuminate too far behind it ? Is there a case where you want to force a faster attenuation of light than the quadratic ?

许多艺术家都问过我关于衰减的问题：如果你想让一个元素上有一个非常强的灯光，但它不会照亮它后面太远的地方，你该怎么做？有没有一种情况，你想强制光的衰减速度比二次函数更快？

Answer is pretty straight-forward : never.

答案很简单：永远不会。

光链接 Light-linking

Light-linking is when a light illuminates only certain objects. It is NOT the same as shadow linking, when you remove some shadow casters from a light. A proper light-linking will keep all the shadow casters as they are.

灯光链接是指灯光仅照亮某些物体。 它不同于阴影链接，阴影链接是指从灯光中移除一些阴影投射器。正确的灯光链接将保持所有阴影投射器的原样。

I have tried to find an example where light-linking (in this case it is lighting in layering but that is essentially the same thing) is a bit extreme. The characters seem to be in a different world than the set.

我曾尝试找一个灯光链接（在本例中是分层照明，但本质上是一样的）有点极端的例子。角色似乎身处与场景不同的世界。

链接至星报 Linking on The Star

Since our workflow allowed it, there was basically light-linking on every shot of ​The Star​. Most of the time my job would be to clean things a bit and simplify light rigs.

由于我们的工作流程允许， 《星星》 的每一个镜头基本上都有灯光连接。大多数时候我的工作是清理一下东西，简化灯光装置。

I haven’t worked on this sequence but it kinda represents the limits of dramatic lighting without any lighting justification.

我没有研究过这个序列，但它有点代表了没有任何照明依据的戏剧照明的极限。

We did output 250 shots per week on this project.

我们在这个项目上每周确实输出了 250 张照片。

I have thought a lot about light-linking and right or wrong. In my opinion it does not make sense to say : light-linking is crap or ​I hate light-linking​. Every studio has its culture and its way of doing things.

我对光链接及其正确与否思考了很多。在我看来，说“光链接是垃圾” 或 “我讨厌光链接” 是没有意义的。每个工作室都有自己的文化和做事方式。

The real question being : is it used properly ?

真正的问题是：它是否被正确使用？

链接乐高蝙蝠侠 Linking on Lego Batman

For example, I did plenty of light-linking on Lego Batman because the art direction was very graphic. I did not use any on The secret life of pets because of its natural look. The only conclusion I could come with is : Light-linking is based on art direction. Honestly, it would have been impossible to do Lego Batman without it.

例如，我在 《乐高蝙蝠侠》 中用了很多光链接，因为艺术指导非常生动。我没有在 《爱宠大机密》 中使用任何光链接，因为它看起来很自然。我得出的唯一结论是：光链接基于艺术指导。 老实说，如果没有它，就不可能制作《乐高蝙蝠侠》。

I used light-linking on batman for his double rims. It was the easiest solution in this case. Otherwise the floor would have been way to bright.

我使用灯光链接来制作蝙蝠侠的双圈。这是本例中最简单的解决方案。否则地板会太亮。

I generally try to avoid light-linking. I only use it if I do not have ANY other options. But it does not mean that it is not a good solution. Depending on the art direction, you may have to rim your characters like crazy. In this case, YES, light-linking is the only solution.

我一般会尽量避免使用光链接。只有在没有其他选择的情况下我才会使用它。 但这并不意味着它不是一个好的解决方案。根据艺术指导，你可能不得不疯狂地为角色添加边框。在这种情况下，是的，光链接是唯一的解决方案。

But I would not start a Master Lighting using it by default. When I begin a sequence, I use lights that affect everything. It is only after dailies and based on the Supervisor’s comments that I will eventually use light-linking.

但我不会默认使用它来开始主照明。当我开始一个序列时，我会使用影响一切的灯光。 只有在每日拍摄结束后，根据主管的评论，我才会最终使用灯光链接。

Planet 51 上的极限光链接 Extreme light-linking on Planet 51

And if you ask me, below is the most extreme light-linking I have ever done in my life. I don’t think I have ever told anyone before. Chuck the astronaut has one sun for his body and one for his face.

如果你问我，下面是我一生中做过的最极端的光链接。我想我以前从未告诉过任何人。宇航员查克的身体上有一颗太阳，脸上也有一颗。

I was not able to get the proper look without doing it this way. But I guess it’s okay because I don’t think you can spot it. Visually it looks like one sun.

如果不这样做，我就无法得到正确的外观。但我想这没关系，因为我认为你看不到它。从视觉上看，它看起来像一个太阳。

I was a mid artist and a bit desperate to get this shot approved.

我是一名中级艺术家，非常希望这张照片能得到批准。

One thing to keep in mind is that the rims cannot be stronger than the source. Because of quadratic decay, the light fades with distance.

需要记住的是，边缘的强度不能高于光源。 由于二次衰减，光线会随着距离的增加而减弱。

灯光链接规则 Light-linking rule

The only advice I could give you about light-linking is from my own experience. It is very personal so take it with a grain of salt. It actually took me a while to realize that. I only do additive light-linking.

关于光链接，我能给你的唯一建议来自我自己的经验。这是非常个人化的建议，所以请谨慎对待。事实上，我花了一段时间才意识到这一点。我只做加法光链接。

I always start with the lights affecting everything. And then I would eventually add a couple of lights only on certain elements. I try to have the highest common denominator for my light rigs. It is very rare for me to remove an object from a light influence.

我总是从影响一切的灯光开始。 然后我最终会只在某些元素上添加几盏灯。我试图为我的灯光装置找到最大的共同点。 我很少将物体从灯光影响中移除。

体积测量 Volumetrics

技术描述 Technical description

Volumetric rendering refers to a technique for generating a visual representation of data that is contained in a three dimensional space (volume). Examples of this are atmospheric effects such as smoke and fog […]. In marching cubes, data is represented as voxels, but in the sense that we store some floating point value in a structured grid in three dimensions. Volume rendering is contrasted with Surface rendering because the data that is being rendered is coming from a three dimensional data set rather than a two dimensional data set (a surface).

体积渲染是指生成三维空间（体积）中包含的数据的视觉表示的技术。 烟雾和雾等大气效果就是一个例子[…]。在行进立方体中，数据表示为体素，但从某种意义上说，我们将一些浮点值存储在三维结构化网格中。体积渲染与表面渲染形成对比，因为正在渲染的数据来自三维数据集，而不是二维数据集（表面）。

Great explanation from this website. Thanks guys !

这个网站的解释很棒。谢谢大家！

容积法配方 Volumetrics Recipe

My personal preference to work on my volumetric is to render it interactively in my master layer. It allows me to check easily its density and color. If you tweak your volumetric shader with all the geometry in matte, you may get some surprises later in comp.

我个人更喜欢在主层中以交互方式渲染体积。这样我可以轻松检查其密度和颜色。 如果您使用遮罩中的所有几何体调整体积着色器，您可能会在后期的合成中得到一些惊喜。

  • I work interactively with everything in the scene.
  • 我与场景中的所有事物进行交互。
  • But I render in separated passes for beauty and volumetric.
  • 但为了美观和体积，我使用不同的通道进行渲染。
  • I generally start with my beauty lights affecting the volumetric. It is easier to set the density this way.
  • 我通常先从影响体积的美颜灯开始。这样设置密度比较容易。
  • Once I am happy with the density, I’ll see if I need to create special volumetric lights or not.
  • 一旦我对密度满意，我就会看看是否需要创建特殊的体积光。

我以前的领导 Victor Pajot 曾经告诉我：体积通道总是看起来很漂亮（因为背景是黑色的）。真正的挑战是当你将它们与美丽融合在一起时。

Volumetric rendering is a bit technical and can possibly give headaches, even to senior artists. One of the most important parameter is the density of your volume. Because it will change greatly its look and its alpha.

体积渲染有点技术性，甚至可能让资深艺术家头疼。最重要的参数之一是体积的密度。因为它会极大地改变其外观和 alpha。

The Arnold website about volumetrics is very well written and easy to understand if you want to read more on the subject.

如果您想了解更多有关该主题的内容， Arnold 网站关于 体积测量的介绍非常详尽且易于理解。

体积合并 Merge of volumetrics

Should we merge in ‘​over​‘ or ‘​plus​‘ the volumetric pass ? I know that ‘over‘ is the correct way and we should definitely try to respect this. BUT production realities sometimes make it impossible. If I am in rush and my volumetric pass is too dense, I’ll do what I have to do.

我们应该在“ over ”或“ plus ”体积通道中进行合并吗？我知道 “ over”是正确的方法， 我们绝对应该尝试尊重这一点。但生产现实有时会使这变得不可能。如果我很着急，并且我的体积通道太密集，我会做我必须做的事情。

If you feel like your volumetric is darkening too much your beauty, you have several options :

如果你觉得你的体积太暗，影响你的美丽，你有几种选择：

  • Decrease the volumetric density (which will have an effect on its alpha).
  • 降低体积密度（这会对其 alpha 产生影响）。
  • Increase the volumetric shader color.
  • 增加体积着色器颜色。
  • Increase the light exposure.
  • 增加光照。
  • If you cannot re-render, you may grade the volumetric pass. Rule of thumb would be to grade color (RGB) and alpha (A) at the same time to keep it consistent.
  • 如果无法重新渲染，您可以对体积通道进行分级。经验法则是同时对颜色 (RGB) 和 alpha (A) 进行分级以保持一致。

On Lego Batman, we used the depth pass. A lot. I am pretty sure half the shots have borders since the depth pass was not defocused nor anti-aliased. It is better to do the fog effect in CG if possible.

在《乐高蝙蝠侠》中，我们使用了深度通道。很多次。我很确定一半的镜头都有边框，因为深度通道没有散焦或抗锯齿。如果可能的话，最好在 CG 中制作雾效。

The art direction is so strong and edit so fast that you do not notice anything.

艺术指导非常强，编辑速度非常快，你不会注意到任何东西。

使用体积法进行颜色分离 Color separation with volumetrics

In the previous paragraphs we have seen a technical description of the volumetrics rendering. But I really to emphasize the fact that volumetrics are also a wonderful tool for the cinematographer.

在前面的段落中，我们已经看到了体积渲染的技术描述。但我真的想强调的是，体积渲染对于电影摄影师来说也是一种很棒的工具。

It is funny how I have changed my mind about this topic. After ​Pets​, I would probably have said stuff like : do not create any special lights for this pass. It is really important that volumetric and beauty have a visual connection.

有趣的是，我对这个话题的看法已经发生了改变。在Pets之后，我可能会说这样的话 ：不要为这个通道创建任何特殊灯光。体积和美感之间的视觉联系非常重要。

Grant and Craig really made me grow as an artist and helped me realize that volumetrics (dust, fog and haze) are a tool for the cinematographer. It will help you to direct the viewer’s eye, enhance drama, create depth, complement the composition or make a character pop.

Grant和Craig确实让我成长为一名艺术家，并帮助我意识到体积（灰尘、雾和霾）是电影摄影师的工具。 它将帮助您引导观众的视线、增强戏剧效果、创造深度、补充构图或使角色突出。

I have been looking at the topic of volumetrics and its use in movies. Something I have been noticing (and that Grant uses perfectly) is the use of cold volumetrics to create depth.

我一直在研究体积测量及其在电影中的应用。我注意到（而且Grant运用得非常好）冷体积测量可以创造深度。

Even if it may not seem technically correct : if my sun light is warm, so should be my volumetric, right ? I firmly believe that it is artistically correct to use cold volumetrics in most cases. Or better said : to use a complementary scheme between the beauty lighting and the volumetric lighting.

即使从技术角度看这似乎并不正确：*如果我的阳光是暖色的，那么我的体积也应该是暖色的，对吗？*​我坚信在大多数情况下使用冷体积在艺术上是正确的。 或者更好地说：在美丽照明和体积照明之间使用互补方案。

Since the sun is warm, plenty of daylight sequences have cold volumetrics in them.

由于太阳是温暖的，许多日光序列中都有冷体积。

我们将在下面的幻灯片中看到此技巧的示例。

顶光 Top Light

The top light is a trick I have actually seen in many companies. In CG we often need to add a light coming from the top to reinforce the sky and give shape. Basically it is a Top Blue Light to reinforce the sky contribution.

顶光是我在许多公司见过的一种技巧。在 CG 中，我们经常需要添加来自顶部的灯光来增强天空并塑造形状。基本上，它是用于增强天空效果的顶部蓝光。

Planet 51 和 顶光 Planet 51 and Top Light

On Planet 51 (Director : ​Jorge Blanco​, Lighting Supervisor : ​Barbara Meyers​), we used the top light on probably 80% of the shots (interior and exterior) of the movie. This is probably the movie I have used it the most.

在 《星球 51》 （导演：Jorge Blanco，灯光总监：Barbara Meyers）中，我们在电影中大约 80% 的镜头（内部和外部）使用了顶灯。这可能是我用得最多的一部电影。

Do you notice the blue specular on the nose and hair of these characters ? It does not come from the SkyLight. Theoretically it should. But very often in CG, Env Lights kinda flatten everything.

你注意到这些角色鼻子和头发上的蓝色高光了吗？它不是来自 SkyLight。理论上它应该是。但在 CG 中，Env Lights 通常会使一切变得平坦。

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

Great culture of character lighting at Ilion.

Ilion 拥有优秀的特色灯光文化。

顶级清淡食谱 Top Light Recipe

The Top Light gives a nice shape to the characters’ faces and possibly adds some extra specular in a very nice way. To enhance the sky, you would :

顶光为角色的脸部提供了漂亮的形状，并可能以非常好的方式添加了一些额外的镜面反射。 为了增强天空的效果，您需要：

  • Create a light coming from the top with very soft shadows.
  • 创建一个从顶部发出的带有非常柔和阴影的光线。
  • On the X axis, value can be around 50 to 90 degrees rotation.
  • 在 X 轴上，值可以大约旋转 50 到 90 度。
  • Make the light blue (for example, R : 0.4 / G : 0.7 / B : 1).
  • 将灯光变为蓝色（例如，R：0.4 / G：0.7 / B：1）。
  • The light should not be too strong, like half a stop exposure.
  • 光线不宜太强，比如半档曝光。

Try to use matte painting in your Env light. In a perfect world, Digital Matte-Painting (DMP) would deliver a 360 skydome in .exr or .hdr format that we could use in our light rigs. So the reflections match the sky used in the final compositing. The Solid Angle documentation explains pretty well the different types of lights.

尝试在 Env 灯光中使用遮罩绘画。在理想情况下，数字遮罩绘画 (DMP) 将以 .exr 或 .hdr 格式提供 360 度天空穹顶，我们可以将其用于我们的灯光装置中。因此反射与最终合成中使用的天空相匹配。 Solid Angle 文档很好地解释了不同类型的灯光。

This is very personal. I know some companies do not work like that at all.

这是非常个人的事情。我知道有些公司根本不是这样做的。

I often wondered why this top direction ? Is this arbitrary or is there a reason to it ? My personal answer is that we are used to light coming from the top 99% of the time. The sky obviously, this giant top light over our heads but it is the same in a restaurant, the subway or the street at night.

我经常想知道为什么这个顶部方向是这样的？这是随意的还是有原因的？ 我个人的答案是，我们习惯了 99% 的时间里光线都来自顶部。显然是天空，我们头顶上是巨大的顶部灯光，但在餐厅、地铁或夜晚的街道上也一样。

​

​

​

This is why lighting from the bottom looks so unnatural, like the Monster lighting.

这就是为什么来自底部的照明看起来如此不自然，就像怪物照明一样。

暖边 Warm edge

Warm edge is a way to enhance the halo (or turbidity) of the sun and to create rich and interesting shadows. I have used this trick on many different projects. It generally makes the border of the shadows more saturated and gives shape to your character when he is not in direct sunlight.

暖边是一种增强太阳光晕（或浑浊度） 并创造丰富有趣的阴影的方法。我在许多不同的项目中都使用过这个技巧。它通常会使阴影的边界更加饱和，并在角色不在阳光直射下时塑造人物形状。

宠物和温暖的边缘 Pets and the Warm Edge

It has to be pretty subtle but still noticeable. You have to find the right balance on this. Warm edge is also called double sun or soft sun trick. Can you see the soft orange halo around the shadow border ? This is what the warm edge would do. Have a look at the example in Chapter 5.

它必须非常微妙但仍然引人注目。你必须找到正确的平衡点。暖边也被称为双太阳或柔和太阳技巧。你能看到阴影边界周围的柔和橙色光晕吗？ 这就是暖边的作用。看看第 5 章中的例子。

​

​

Warm sun and cold shadows were the motto.

温暖的阳光和寒冷的阴影是座右铭。

When you create a directional key light, it represents the sun. But what about its halo ? How can we enhance this ?

当您创建定向主光时，它代表太阳。但它的光晕呢？ 我们如何增强它？

The halo is also called Turbidity in the Hosek-Wilkie Skylight model from 2012.

在 2012 年的Hosek-Wilkie天窗模型中，这个光晕也被称为浊度。

You can definitely tweak the turbidity to soften your shadows. But it will not give you a proper warm edge.

您当然可以调整浊度来柔化阴影。但这不会给您带来适当的暖边。

暖边配方 Warm Edge Recipe

  • Duplicate your sun or key light.
  • 复制太阳光或主光。
  • Make the color more saturated (for example, R : 1 / G : 0.4 / B : 0.1).
  • 使颜色更饱和（例如，R：1/G：0.4/B：0.1）。
  • Decrease approximately the intensity by 1 or 2 stops.
  • 将强度降低约 1 或 2 级。
  • Set the shadows way softer. The softer the shadows, the bigger the warm edge will be.
  • 将阴影设置得更柔和。阴影越柔和，暖边就越大。
  • It will create a warm edge effect on your shadow.
  • 它会在你的阴影上产生温暖的边缘效果。

The whole debate about the warm edge is : should the Sun Soft have the same orientation than the Sun ? I have seen both setups. Theoretically they should have the same orientation. But sometimes it really helps to slightly rotate the Sun Soft to wrap better the character.

关于暖边的整个争论是：Sun Soft 的方向是否应该与Sun相同？我见过这两种设置。理论上它们应该具有相同的方向。但有时稍微旋转Sun Soft确实有助于更好地包裹角色。

So I would say this : start with the same orientation for both lights and if needed rotate theSun Softslightly. There is a double advantage to this technique : we help the render engine with some direct lighting and it allows to shape things that would normally be in shadow.

所以我想说：首先让两盏灯的方向相同，如果需要，稍微旋转一下Sun Soft。 这种技术有双重优势：我们通过一些直接照明帮助渲染引擎，并且它允许塑造通常处于阴影中的物体。

During my holidays in Spain on Planet 51, I went to this beach where during sunset the sun would disappear behind a building. I noticed that after it disappeared, there was still some soft warm light coming from its halo. We used a lot this technique on Planet 51 and it made me feel more confident about it after experiencing it in real life.

我在 Planet 51 上西班牙度假期间，去过一个海滩，那里日落时分，太阳会消失在建筑物后面。我注意到，太阳消失后，光晕中仍会发出柔和的暖光。 我们在 Planet 51 上大量使用了这种技术，在现实生活中体验后，我对此更加有信心。

预测 Projections

焦散 Caustics

Caustics are a very specific type of indirect lighting. They produce patterns of light when photons are reflected or refracted by a curved surface. They can be bounced off by a mirror or concentrated by a lens. Most famous caustics are the distortion of light at the bottom of a swimming-pool or the patterns refracted by a glass of water.

焦散是一种非常特殊的间接照明。当光子被曲面反射或折射时，它们会产生光的图案。 它们可以被镜子反射或被透镜聚集。最著名的焦散是游泳池底部的光线扭曲或一杯水折射的图案。

Have you heard this story about a jaguar which melted in London because of a building ?

你听说过一只美洲虎因伦敦一栋建筑而融化的故事吗？

​

​

​

Just an example to show you how strong caustics can be.

仅举一个例子来向您展示焦散的强度。

Caustics are a natural phenomenon and some render engines do support them. But I have never worked on a movie where we would output caustics directly in CG. Reason is pretty simple : caustics are expensive. Instead, we generally re-create them with a map. There are four good reasons for that :

焦散是一种自然现象，一些渲染引擎确实支持焦散。但我从未在电影中直接在 CG 中输出焦散。原因很简单：焦散很昂贵。 相反，我们通常使用贴图重新创建它们。这样做有四个很好的理由：

  • It is much cheaper this way.
  • 这样就便宜多了。
  • We also have more control on their look.
  • 我们对他们的外观也有更多的控制权。
  • We can place them wherever we want.
  • 我们可以把它们放在任何我们想要的地方。
  • It adds details to the shot.
  • 它为镜头添加了细节。

焦散线示例 Examples of Caustics

I personally see caustics as a tool. Sometimes when I feel my light rig is well-balanced but I want to highlight an element or guide a bit more the viewer’s eye, I know that caustics are a good way to do so.

我个人认为焦散是一种工具。有时，当我觉得我的灯光装置很平衡，但我想突出某个元素或引导观众的视线时，我知道焦散是一种很好的方法。

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

You can use caustics to enhance your shots. They are very useful.

你可以使用焦散来增强你的拍摄效果。它们非常有用。

焦散光配方 Caustics Light Recipe

  • Duplicate your sun or key light.
  • 复制太阳光或主光。
  • Decrease approximately the intensity by 1 or 2 stops.
  • 将强度降低约 1 或 2 级。
  • Keep the sharp shadows ! That’s very important.
  • 保持清晰的阴影！这非常重要。
  • Use a map in your light. It could even be an animated sequence for a pool for example.
  • 在灯光中使用地图。例如，它甚至可以是泳池的动画序列。

If you have a look at the sequence below, you’ll notice some animated caustics on the wall of the pool.

如果您看一下下面的序列，您会注意到泳池墙壁上有一些动画焦散。

For some unknown reason, caustics are not present in every shot. Looks like a mistake.

由于某些未知原因，焦散并非出现在每个镜头中。看起来像是一个错误。

Caustics are a really nice effect to achieve in CG. Their textures add details, like on a wall for example, and make the render more interesting. Most of the time we avoid flat colors on big surfaces (like a wall) using extra impacts of lights or caustics. This is probably the biggest difference between 2D and 3D. We cannot afford the lack of details in 3D. Otherwise it will just look visually poor and cheap.

焦散是 CG 中非常不错的效果。它们的纹理可以增加细节，例如墙壁上的细节，并使渲染更有趣。大多数时候，我们会使用额外的灯光或焦散效果来避免在较大的表面（如墙壁）上使用平面颜色。 这可能是 2D 和 3D 之间最大的区别。我们不能承受 3D 中细节的缺失。否则它看起来会很差，很廉价。

I thought for a very long time that caustics were only caused by refraction rays. But not at all ! In Arnold’s website, they mention the different types of caustics : reflective, refractive and glossy. Interesting !

很长一段时间以来，我一直认为焦散只是由折射光线引起的。但完全不是！在Arnold 的网站上，他们提到了不同类型的焦散：反射焦散、折射焦散和光泽焦散。有趣！

卡通灯光 Cartoon lighting

I had once a debate about :is there such a thing as Cartoon Lighting ? Or does the cartoon look come from mainly grading and saturation ? After having given it many thoughts and thanks to the mental image we have seen in the previous paragraph, I will stick to my answer : yes, there is such a thing as cartoon lighting. Mental image is cartoon lighting.

我曾经争论过：卡通照明是否存在？ 或者卡通外观主要来自分级和饱和度？经过深思熟虑，并感谢我们在上一段中看到的​心理形象​，我坚持我的答案：是的，卡通照明存在。心理形象就是卡通照明。

Does it mean that I light differently based on the nature of the project ? In a way, I want to say “​yes​“. Each movie with its own unique art direction should require a different lighting style. But in reality, since Hollywood does not like taking risks, most PBR movies end up with the same lighting design. Which makes me light the same way on different movies.

这是否意味着我会根据项目的性质采用不同的灯光？在某种程度上，我想说“​是​”。每部具有独特艺术指导的电影都应该采用不同的灯光风格。但实际上，由于好莱坞不喜欢冒险，大多数 PBR 电影最终都采用相同的灯光设计。这使我在不同的电影上采用相同的灯光方式。

IES 灯光 IES Lights

IES stands for ‘Illuminating Engineering Society‘. It is a society that brings together lighting experts (e.g. lighting designers, consultants, engineers, sales professionals, architects, researchers, lighting equipment manufacturers, etc.) to better design lighting conditions in the real world.

IES 是“照明工程学会”的缩写。它是一个汇集照明专家（例如照明设计师、顾问、工程师、销售专业人员、建筑师、研究人员、照明设备制造商等）的学会，旨在更好地设计现实世界中的照明条件。

IES files contain measurement data about the light distribution of a lighting fixture in an ASCII format. These files are typically used by lighting fixture manufacturers to electronically transfer photometric data over the web. Basically an IES file is the digital profile of a real world light.

IES 文件包含 ASCII 格式的照明设备光分布测量数据。照明设备制造商通常使用这些文件通过网络以电子方式传输光度数据。IES文件基本上是真实世界光的数字配置文件。

​

IES are downloadable for free from manufacturer’s and some CG websites.

IES 可以从制造商和一些 CG 网站免费下载。
